title: Instagram snapshots: Gregory Smith's roadside Americana
text:
Instagram snapshots: Gregory Smith's roadside Americana Architectural historian and traveller Gregory Smith, documents the buildings and artefacts of the 20th-century commercial landscape in the US. Here he celebrates iconic roadside sights in Texas and North Carolina
Share your travels in Instagram pictures with a series of three snaps, plus captions, and by adding #guardiantravelsnaps Follow Guardian Travel on Instagram at guardiantravelsnaps Find photo inspiration from our Instagram Snapshots series Wednesday 19 August 2015 10.57 BST
Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share via Email Share on Pinterest Share on Google+ Share on WhatsApp Light Bulb Shop, Austin, Texas
Designed and built by Austin’s Blue Genie Art Industries in the 1990s, the iconic Light Bulb Shop man demonstrates how contemporary signage can still rise to the level of art.
• All photographs: clive78757 on Instagram
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close Travelers Hotel, San Antonio, Texas
Built in 1914, the Travelers Hotel in downtown San Antonio offered basic amenities to salesmen and other people seeking budget accommodation. After years of disuse, it is now slated for rehabilitation as a boutique hotel.
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close Shell Gas Station, Winston-Salem, North Carolina
Constructed in 1930, this service station is the last of at least eight similar buildings once found in the Winston-Salem area. It now serves as a regional office of Preservation North Carolina.
